3.2.1.title: Security-Awareness Training for All Personnel
3.2.1.officialRequirement: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities.
3.2.1.why: IBM’s 2024 report shows **95 %** of breaches trace back to human error. If MVL’s people don’t recognise phishing, social-engineering, or sloppy data-handling mistakes, no tech stack can save our CUI or our SPRS score (current 83, target 90).

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Deploy **KnowBe4** (or M365 Attack Simulation) for monthly micro-modules & phishing tests.
SSO the platform with Entra ID; completions sync to LMS (`/learn`) via SCIM.
Create Power BI dashboard fed by the KnowBe4 API → shows fail-rate, click-rate, and improvement trend to SOC & execs.
Teams bot *“SecBot”* posts just-in-time tips when a user reports a phish with the Outlook ‘Report’ button.
Set conditional access policy: users who miss 2+ consecutive modules get ‘high-risk user’ flag (extra MFA prompts).
Integrate Sentinel with KnowBe4 so repeat clickers trigger automated ticket for follow-up coaching.

employeePerspective.title: What This Means for Employees
content: Expect a **15-minute video or game-style quiz every month**—complete by month-end.
Random phishing simulations drop in quarterly; failing one auto-assigns a 5-minute remedial clip.
Top performers hit the leaderboard on #🎉-wins each quarter (gift-card incentive).
See a sketchy email? Click **‘Report Phish’**; it helps train our filters *and* scores you 🔒 points.
Security tips pop up in Teams—think of them as seat-belts for your keyboard.

managementPerspective.title: Business Impact & Risk Management
content: KnowBe4 data: sustained programmes cut phishing click-rates from 29 % → **< 3 %** in a year.
Cyber-insurance renewal asks for proof of continuous training—this module checks that box.
CMMC assessors look for evidence (roster + content + frequency); dashboard export fulfils the artifact.
FY24 KPI: drive aggregate click-rate below **5 %**; currently 4.8 % after two quarters.

mvlTips: Monthly **“MVL Cyber Snapshot”** newsletter summarises real incidents (names redacted) to keep it tangible.
Fail-safe: if a module isn’t done by the 25-th, LMS nudges via email, SMS, and a Teams pop-up.
CISO joins the all-hands once a year for a live ‘Stupid Hack Tricks’ demo—big engagement boost.
steps: Integrate KnowBe4 SSO with Entra ID.
Import HR org structure to auto-enrol all new hires on day 1.
Schedule baseline phishing test; record click-rate.
Roll out monthly micro-learning path (12 topics per year).
Wire API feed into Power BI dashboard; set targets & alerts.
Publish programme charter on MVL Policy site and link in LMS.

quiz.q: Roughly what percentage of breaches involve human error?
quiz.explanation: IBM’s ‘Cost of a Data Breach 2024’ pegs human error at ~95 % of successful attacks—why training matters.

3.2.2.title: Role-Based Security Training
3.2.2.officialRequirement: Ensure that organizational personnel are trained to carry out their assigned information security-related duties and responsibilities.
3.2.2.why: Developers need secure coding; finance needs BEC defences; execs need insider-threat spotting. One-size-fits-all wastes time and leaves gaps.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Map Azure AD groups → LMS ‘tracks’ (Dev, Admin, Finance, Exec, Field).
Developers: **Secure Code Warrior** hands-on labs + GitHub Advanced Security scan triage as homework.
Admins: **PIM** & **Defender** labs inside an Azure Sandbox (subscription auto-nukes nightly).
Finance/HR: quarterly BEC & privacy tabletop run via Teams Breakout + Forms quiz.
Automatic HR feed: job-role change triggers LMS track switch within 24 h (SCIM).
Completion metrics exported to PURVIEW Compliance Manager to close CA-3 evidence gap.

employeePerspective.title: What This Means for Employees
content: Your training playlist adapts when you change roles—new modules unlock, old ones retire.
Technical staff get **hands-on ‘break‐&-fix’ labs** instead of PowerPoints.
Managers see risk-focused briefs (BEC, legal hold, data-spill response).
Missed role modules show as red in your dashboard and in your performance objectives.

managementPerspective.title: Business Impact & Risk Management
content: **65 % fewer role-specific incidents** reported after year-one rollout (Ponemon study mirrors our pilot).
Helps satisfy auditors that ‘knowledge, skills, and abilities’ exist for each control owner.
Reduces mean-time-to-remediate code vulns by **47 %** (Dev track).

mvlTips: Quarterly insider-threat case study for execs uses anonymised MVL log data—keeps it real.
Sandbox labs spin up in MVL’s Azure sponsorship—zero prod risk.
Role tracks are reviewed every sprint with the CAB to keep content fresh.
steps: Define role matrix → map to AAD groups.
Create LMS tracks and load content (Secure Code Warrior, Policy videos, labs).
Build HR-to-AAD SCIM sync to auto-switch tracks.
Publish KPI: role-track completion ≥ 95 % each quarter.
Report metrics to steering committee monthly.

quiz.q: Which MVL platform delivers hands-on secure-coding challenges?
quiz.explanation: Secure Code Warrior provides interactive labs matched to MVL’s Dev role track.

3.2.3.title: Insider-Threat Awareness & Reporting
3.2.3.officialRequirement: Provide security training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat in accordance with the organization's insider-threat program.
3.2.3.why: Half of MVL’s cyber-insurance questionnaire focuses on insider threat. One disgruntled admin dumping CUI to a USB stick could cost contracts and reputation overnight.

itPerspective.title: IT Professional Implementation
content: Integrate **Microsoft Insider Risk Management** (IRM) alerts with the LMS: each medium+ IRM alert auto-assigns the user a refresher micro-module.
Quarterly tabletop: SOC + HR + Legal walk through an insider-leak scenario; output updates our Playbook *IR-07*.
Sentinel connector pulls IRM audit data for UEBA—keeps false positives manageable.
Teams app ‘See Something – Say Something’ button opens a pre-filled confidential report to HR & SOC.

employeePerspective.title: What This Means for Employees
content: Annual 20-min insider-threat module uses MVL case studies (data anonymised).
You’ll learn red-flags: sudden overtime + large OneDrive uploads, unusual encryption usage, off-hours cloud access.
Reporting is anonymous via the Teams button; whistle-blower policy protects you.
If IRM flags odd activity on your account, expect a polite check-in from the SOC—not a witch hunt.

managementPerspective.title: Business Impact & Risk Management
content: ACFE 2024 shows median insider-fraud loss $125 k; early detection can halve that.
Demonstrates to DoD that MVL meets National Insider Threat Task Force guidance.
Supports ISO 27001 A.7.3 evidence if MVL pursues certification.

mvlTips: ‘Coffee & Culture’ monthly talk highlights a real insider case from industry to keep awareness high.
IRM policy tuned to MVL baselines—< 1 % false positive rate last quarter.
Lessons-learned from any insider event feed straight back into this module within 30 days.
steps: Enable Microsoft IRM; define high-risk indicators (mass download + USB).
Build Power Automate flow → IRM alert ➜ assign LMS refresher.
Publish anonymous-reporting SOP; pin Teams button in company-wide channel.
Run quarterly tabletop; update Playbook IR-07 accordingly.
Track insider-alert metrics; goal: triage P1 insiders within 2 h.

quiz.q: Which MVL service auto-assigns refresher training when insider-risk alerts fire?
answers: Microsoft Insider Risk Management + Power Automate
quiz.explanation: The IRM + Power Automate flow links real-world risk events directly to immediate micro-training.
